metadata.name: Basic Probability Experiment
metadata.author: Card Game Engine
metadata.description: Simple probability simulator for 7th-grade students. Explore experimental vs theoretical probability with customizable experiments.

instructions.overview: Run probability experiments using playing cards. Track results and compare experimental probability to theoretical predictions. Perfect for 7th-grade math students!
setup: Click the Settings ⚙️ button to configure your experiment
Choose how many decks to use (1-8)
Set how many cards to flip per trial
gameplay: Click 'Flip Cards' to manually draw cards
Click 'Auto Flip' to run multiple trials automatically
Watch as results appear in the table at the bottom
Compare your results to the theoretical probability
Click 'New Round' to start tracking a new round
Click 'Clear Results' to reset all data
instructions.winning: This is an educational tool with no win condition. Success is understanding how experimental results approach theoretical predictions with more trials!
